derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent. (as doldrum 'dull, sluggish person'): perhaps from dull, on the pattern of tantrums

entry.def: If an activity or situation is in the doldrums, it is very quiet and nothing new or exciting is happening.

example.ex: The economy is in the doldrums.

means.word_mean: 1. a state of inactivity (in business or art etc);

sentences.sentence: "economic growth of less than 1% per year is considered to be economic stagnation"

means.word_mean: 2. a belt of calms and light winds between the northern and southern trade winds of the Atlantic and Pacific

sentences.en: The industry remains in the doldrums, according to official figures out today.
sentences.cn: 根据今天官方公布的数字，这个行业仍不景气。

sentences.en: Property sales have been in the doldrums for some time.

sentences.en: He was in the doldrums for the whole winter.
sentences.cn: 整个冬天他都无精打采。
